title: Classrooms
copy: The H-E-B Discovery Center features two ‘dirty’ classrooms that allow students of all ages to get their hands dirty in a classroom setting. These classrooms seat 50 students and can be combined to create a larger classroom or meeting space. Hands-on classes will explore many subjects with an underlying theme of environmental education including ecology, biology and chemistry.

title: Halsell Welcome Building
copy: The Halsell Welcome Building, along with the new Gift Shop, creates the dramatic new entrance to the San Antonio Botanical Garden, and contains the educational and volunteer offices.

title: Mays Family Display Garden
copy: The Mays Family Display Garden, featuring long-blooming plants with a hot color scheme and a cool cascading water feature, is located on a wide promenade that leads to the new Family Adventure Garden, opening in Spring, or over to established Botanical Garden areas such as the Lucile Halsell Conservatory.

title: The H-E-B Discovery Center
copy: The H-E-B Discovery Center, which features educational facilities, has a wide breezeway connecting the Mays Family Display Garden with the Culinary Garden.

title: The Chef's Amphitheater
copy: The circular amphitheater in the Culinary Garden is a place for tour and student groups to meet.

title: The Culinary Garden
copy: The Culinary Garden will grow some 200 different seasonal vegetables, fruits and herbs for farm-to-table cooking classes and other events in the outdoor kitchen.

title: The Chef's Outdoor Kitchen
copy: Chef Dave Terrazas will harvest food straight from the garden and move directly to the CHEF (Culinary Health Education for Families) Teaching Kitchen in the Goldsbury Foundation Pavilion for hands-on lessons in a “garden-to-table” experience that deepens the connections between gardening and healthy cooking.

title: The Culinary Garden
copy: The Culinary Garden features 34 limestone-bordered beds for growing nearly 200 varieties of fruits, vegetables and herbs in season. Underneath the garden is a massive, 29,000-gallon cistern, fed by rainwater and air-conditioning system condensate.

title: Education Center
copy: The Exploration Station is a first stop for guests to get oriented to the park, plan their day and meet tour guides. Multimedia programs will highlight the importance of plants, our region’s water story, environmental stewardship techniques you can do at home, and engaging nature play activities. And a glance at t the Bloom Cart will show visitors what’s blooming in the garden that day.

title: Mays Family Display Garden
copy: The Mays Family Display Garden, featuring long-blooming plants with a hot color scheme and a cool cascading water feature, is located on a wide promenade that leads to the new Family Adventure Garden, opening in Spring, or over to established Botanical Garden areas such as the Lucile Halsell Conservatory.

title: Gift shop
copy: The new gift shop features all kinds of nature-related toys, games and gifts, ranging from rosemary-infused chocolate to blossom-scented lotions and candles, jewelry and nature-inspired children’s books. “It’s the best gift shop in South Texas,” said Botanical Garden executive director Bob Brackman.
